title: Girl, 17, who was shot dead in Homewood identified
content:
A teenage girl was shot and killed Saturday in a volley of bullets on a Homewood street.
Officers responded to a gunshot detector notification about 3:10 p.m. that 11 shots had been fired in the 5900 block of Upland Street.
They found that Daija McCall, 17, of Homewood had been shot while walking near the intersection of Mount Vernon and Belmar streets.
Friends and relatives gathered at a nearby house to comfort each other over their inconsolable loss.
“She was a good girl,” said Ebony Tolliver, a close friend of McCall's mother. “She took care of her brother.”
McCall would help anyone who asked, said Tolliver and other people who saw McCall grow up.
“She could sing,” Tolliver said. “She had the voice of an angel.”
Paramedics said McCall was dead at the scene. Police still are investigating and don't have a description of a shooter or how the shooting occurred, Pittsburgh Public Safety spokeswoman Sonya Toler said.
“We don't know how it happened,” she said.
The incident was the second reported shooting in Homewood in less than 24 hours.
Police found a man, 22, suffering from gunshot wounds on Hamilton Avenue about 3:30 a.m. Saturday.
Paramedics transported him to UPMC Presbyterian, where he was in stable condition.
Brian Bowling is a Tribune-Review staff writer. Reach him at 412-325-4301 or bowling@tribweb.com.
